net.sf.mmm.client.ui.api.widget.complex

Interface UiWidgetAbstractDataTable<ROW>

  • Type Parameters:
    ROW - is the generic type of a row in the list.
    All Superinterfaces:
    AbstractValidatableObject, Accessibility, AttributeReadAriaRole, AttributeReadDisposed, AttributeReadEditable, AttributeReadEnabled, AttributeReadHtmlId, AttributeReadId<String>, AttributeReadMode, AttributeReadModeFixed, AttributeReadModified, AttributeReadPrimaryStyle, AttributeReadSelectedValue<ROW>, AttributeReadSelectionMode, AttributeReadStringTitle, AttributeReadStyles, AttributeReadStylesAdvanced, AttributeReadSummary, AttributeReadTitle<String>, AttributeReadTitleVisible, AttributeReadTooltip, AttributeReadVisible, AttributeReadVisibleRecursive, AttributeWriteDisposed, AttributeWriteEditable, AttributeWriteEnabled, AttributeWriteHtmlId, AttributeWriteId<String>, AttributeWriteMode, AttributeWriteModeFixed, AttributeWritePrimaryStyle, AttributeWriteSelectedValue<ROW>, AttributeWriteSelectionMode, AttributeWriteStringTitle, AttributeWriteStyles, AttributeWriteStylesAdvanced, AttributeWriteSummary, AttributeWriteTitle<String>, AttributeWriteTitleVisible, AttributeWriteTooltip, AttributeWriteVisible, AttributeWriteVisibleAdvanced, UiFeature, UiFeatureEvent, UiFeatureMessages, UiFeatureMode, UiFeatureSelectedValue<ROW>, UiWidget, UiWidgetAbstractDataSet<ROW>, UiWidgetRegular, UiWidgetWithSelectedValue<ROW>
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    UiWidgetAbstractListTable<ROW>, UiWidgetListTable<ROW>, UiWidgetOptionListTable<ROW>, UiWidgetTreeTable<NODE>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractUiWidgetAbstractDataTable, AbstractUiWidgetAbstractListTable, AbstractUiWidgetListTable, UiWidgetCustomAbstractListTable, UiWidgetCustomListTable, UiWidgetListTableGwt

    public interface UiWidgetAbstractDataTable<ROW>
extends UiWidgetAbstractDataSet<ROW>
    This is the abstract interface for a data set widget that represents a data table. That is a table showing rows of data with their attributes in columns. It has the following features:
    • Configured via its columns.
    • Each column defines attributes like ID, title, and tooltip that will be used for the header of the column.
    • Scrolling of the table rows as needed while header (and potential footer) remains steady.
    • columns can be sorted using custom comparators by clicking the column header. Clicking again will swap between ascending and descending order what is also visualized by an arrow icon.
    • columns can be resized by clicking to the right of the column header and moving the right column border horizontally.
    • columns can be reordered by dragging them around.
    • columns can be edited by double-clicking on cells or programmatically.
    • ...

    Note:
    There are the following variants of this abstract list table widget:
    • UiWidgetListTable
    • UiWidgetOptionListTable
    • UiWidgetTreeTable
    Since:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    Joerg Hohwiller (hohwille at users.sourceforge.net)

    • Method Detail

      • createColumn

        <CELL> UiWidgetTableColumn<ROW,CELL> createColumn(TypedProperty<CELL> rowProperty,
                                                  UiSingleWidgetFactory<? extends UiWidgetWithValue<CELL>> widgetFactory,
                                                  Comparator<CELL> sortComparator)
        This method creates a new column for this table.
        ATTENTION:
        The column is not automatically added to the table. You need to call setColumns(List) for all columns that should appear in the UI.
        Type Parameters:
        CELL - is the generic type of the property type.
        Parameters:
        rowProperty - is the TypedProperty identifying which property of <ROW> to show in the column.
        widgetFactory - is the factory to create widgets for this column. ATTENTION: These widgets might be reused for performance-reasons for a different row just by setting its value. They should NOT contain additional state information (what is generally a bad idea). This parameter may be null to fall back to datatype based creation.
        sortComparator - is the sort-comparator to set.
        Returns:
        a new UiWidgetTableColumn.

      • createColumn

        <CELL> UiWidgetTableColumn<ROW,CELL> createColumn(PropertyAccessor<ROW,CELL> rowAccessor,
                                                  UiSingleWidgetFactory<? extends UiWidgetWithValue<CELL>> widgetFactory,
                                                  Comparator<CELL> sortComparator)
        This method creates a new column for this table.
        ATTENTION:
        The column is not automatically added to the table. You need to call setColumns(List) for all columns that should appear in the UI.
        Type Parameters:
        CELL - is the generic type of the property value.
        Parameters:
        rowAccessor - is the PropertyAccessor to access the property of <ROW> to show in the column.
        widgetFactory - is the factory to create widgets for this column. ATTENTION: These widgets might be reused for performance-reasons for a different row just by setting its value. They should NOT contain additional state information (what is generally a bad idea). This parameter may be null to fall back to datatype based creation.
        sortComparator - is the sort-comparator to set.
        Returns:
        a new UiWidgetTableColumn.

      • setColumns

        void setColumns(List<? extends UiWidgetTableColumn<ROW,?>> columns)
        This method sets the columns for the table of this model.
        You typically will call this method like this: 
        list.setColumns(Arrays.asList(column1, column2, column3))
        Unfortunately varargs with generics cause trouble in interfaces.
        ATTENTION:
        This method should typically be called only once during initialization of this table. Multiple calls of this method for dynamic changes of the UI may NOT be completely supported by all underlying implementations. We recommend to test your code with all relevant implementations before investing in multiple dynamic changes. Consider AttributeWriteVisibleAdvanced.setVisible(boolean) instead if possible.
        Parameters:
        columns - are the columns to set. Use createColumn to create before.
        See Also:
        createColumn(TypedProperty, UiSingleWidgetFactory, Comparator), createColumn(PropertyAccessor, UiSingleWidgetFactory, Comparator)

      • getColumnCount

        int getColumnCount()
        Returns:
        the number of columns that are currently set.
        See Also:
        List.size()

      • getColumn

        UiWidgetTableColumn<ROW,?> getColumn(int index)
        This method gets the column at the given index.
        Parameters:
        index - is the index of the requested column. The index corresponds to the index when the columns have been set. Reordering or hiding columns in the UI has no effect on the index. The value has to be in the range from 0 to getColumnCount() - 1.
        Returns:
        the requested column.
        See Also:
        List.get(int)

      • getSelectionColumn

        UiWidgetTableColumn<?,Boolean> getSelectionColumn()
        Gets implicit column that shows the checkboxes or radios for the selection of a row.
        ATTENTION:
        This is available for advanced flexibility. Please avoid changing title, reorderable, resizable, or sortable.
        Returns:
        the implicit column that shows the checkboxes or radios for the selection of a row.

      • getRowNumberColumn

        UiWidgetTableColumn<?,Integer> getRowNumberColumn()
        Gets implicit column that shows the row-numbers.
        ATTENTION:
        This is available for advanced flexibility. Please avoid changing title, reorderable, resizable, or sortable.
        This column may be lazily created. Only use if you want to make it visible.
        Returns:
        the implicit column that shows the row-numbers.

      • getColumnById

        UiWidgetTableColumn<ROW,?> getColumnById(String columnId,
                                         boolean required)
                                  throws ObjectNotFoundException
        This method gets the column with the given columnId.
        Parameters:
        columnId - is the ID of the requested column.
        required - - if true and the requested column does not exist, an exception is thrown, false otherwise (null will be returned for non existent columns).
        Returns:
        the requested column or null if no such column exists and required is false.
        Throws:
        ObjectNotFoundException - if no column exists with the given columnId and required is true.
